microkeras.models.sequential package

Submodules

microkeras.models.sequential.add module

microkeras.models.sequential.add.add(self, layer)[source]

Add a layer to the Sequential model.

If the layer doesn’t have an input_shape and there are existing layers, the input shape is inferred from the previous layer’s units.

Parameters: layer (Layer): The layer to be added to the model.

microkeras.models.sequential.build module

microkeras.models.sequential.build.build(self)[source]

Build all layers in the Sequential model.

This method calls the build method of each layer in the model, initializing their weights and biases.

microkeras.models.sequential.compile module

microkeras.models.sequential.compile.compile(model, optimizer, loss, metrics)[source]

Compile the Sequential model.

This method configures the model for training by setting the optimizer, loss function, and metrics.

Parameters: model (Sequential): The model to compile. optimizer (Optimizer): The optimizer to use for training. loss (str): The loss function to use. metrics (list): List of metrics to be evaluated during training and testing.

microkeras.models.sequential.copy module

microkeras.models.sequential.copy.copy(self)[source]

Create a deep copy of the Sequential model.

Returns: Sequential: A new Sequential model instance with copied layers.

microkeras.models.sequential.evaluate module

microkeras.models.sequential.evaluate.evaluate(self, X_test, y_test)[source]

Evaluate the model on the given test data.

Parameters:

  • X_test (numpy.ndarray) – Test input data.

  • y_test (numpy.ndarray) – True labels for the test data.

Returns:

If ‘accuracy’ is in metrics, returns (loss, accuracy), otherwise returns only the loss.

Return type:

float or tuple

Raises:

ValueError – If the model hasn’t been compiled.

microkeras.models.sequential.fit module

microkeras.models.sequential.fit.fit(self, X_train, y_train, batch_size=32, epochs=1)[source]

Train the model on the given data.

Parameters: X_train (numpy.ndarray): Training input data. y_train (numpy.ndarray): True labels for the training data. batch_size (int): Number of samples per gradient update. Default is 32. epochs (int): Number of epochs to train the model. Default is 1.

Returns: dict: Training history containing loss and metric values.

Raises: ValueError: If the model hasn’t been compiled.

microkeras.models.sequential.initialize module

microkeras.models.sequential.initialize.initialize(self, layers)[source]

Initialize the Sequential model with given layers.

Parameters: layers (list): List of Layer instances to add to the model.

microkeras.models.sequential.load module

microkeras.models.sequential.load.load(cls, filename)[source]

Load a Sequential model from a file.

Parameters: filename (str): Path to the file containing the saved model.

Returns: Sequential: A new Sequential model instance loaded from the file.

microkeras.models.sequential.predict module

microkeras.models.sequential.predict.predict(self, X)[source]

Generate output predictions for the input samples.

Parameters: X (numpy.ndarray): Input data.

Returns: numpy.ndarray: Predictions for the input data.

microkeras.models.sequential.save module

microkeras.models.sequential.save.save(self, filename)[source]

Save the Sequential model to a file.

Parameters: filename (str): Path where the model should be saved.

microkeras.models.sequential.sequential module

class microkeras.models.sequential.sequential.Sequential(layers)[source]

Bases: object

Sequential groups a linear stack of layers into a model.

The Sequential model is a linear stack of layers, useful for straightforward architectures. Layers are added via the constructor or through the .add() method.

layers

List of layers in the model.

Type:

list
